reviewText: Its so wonderful to watch these episodes again!!  Its like watching them for the first time and they still pack a wallop.  Whenever a new release date for a season is announced I count the days for this show!!  There will never be another like it.  I watched "Amazing Grace" pts. one and two last evening and I cried my eyes out!!  What's nice about these seasons is that there is an interplay between "Promised Land" (TBAAs spin off) and TBAA.  Now I just wish they would speed up the releases.  Its bad enough having to split the seasons in two just so they can make more money but to have to wait almost ten months in between is just too much!!  Hurry up with season four now!!  Oh, and let me make a pitch in for 'Promised Land'.  Lets get it out on DVD too!!  Quality shows all the way....nothing the way TV is today...all muck and garbage.

reviewText: This is one of my favorite series. I own all of the first three seasons, and will eventually purchase the rest. Tess, Monica and Andrew are angels who help people on Earth, sometimes secretly, sometimes letting people know they are angels. There are many excellent guest stars.--------- ARE THERE ANGELS TOUCHING US? ---------I know that angels work in our lives. Sometimes, our angels are human friends or strangers that help us when we need it, without their even knowing it. Sometimes, we act as angels, perhaps by an angelic nudge in our mind, to help strangers. Let me give two examples.*** I get touched by an angelic urge ***Years ago, while I was attending a convention at a campground in NW Arkansas, I felt the sudden urge to leave my laptop in an unlocked room in an unlocked building and go to chow by a route that I had never used before, walking through the worship center and out a door that was on the farthest side of the building from where I'd been working on my computer.When I get outside and partway down an empty path between buildings, I come across a crying tot. She was lost and looking for her parents. It was so far away from where I started, I couldn't have possibly heard her. I pick her up and carry her immediately to the chow hall, where I tell people that know the parents that I found her, and that we'll be eating.I know that God or an angel touched me that day, and used me as an angel in that young girl's life.*** When someone else is Touched by an Angel to come to my aid ***In 2012, my sister asked me to proofread her book,On Higher Ground. She mailed me the manuscript, and while I was a few pages into it, I realized that my paperback dictionary was not as good a reference as I'd hoped, so I wrote her a note asking her to order me a Collegiate dictionary.Before I could mail that letter, a friend walked up and asked me if I had a paperback dictionary. I said I did. He asked if I'd be willing to trade. He wanted a lighter dictionary that wasn't as heavy as his. I said YES, and what did he give me?Merriam-Webster's Collegiate Dictionary (Laminated Cover)(the latest, eleventh edition).My friend had no idea that I needed that dictionary. I don't even think he knew I was proofreading Paula's book. It was about twelve hours AFTER I'd written the note to my sister.I believe than Henry was touched by an angel, because I was the first person he asked, when he decided he wanted to trade dictionaries, and he did it as an even swap.By the way, if you enjoy Touched by an Angel, I highly recommendOn Higher Groundby Paula Hrbacek. It is the story of two guardian angels who help humans in need, without being obvious about the help that they are providing.JohnThe same John mentioned at the beginning of Paula's book.

reviewText: There is nothing I did not Like about Touched By An Angel. One hundred percent satisfied, a penny well spent.Roma Downey, Della Reese, John Dey, a fine cast from the start. There are humbling moments during each episode, and storylines that show you more than what you're ready for. This is everyday life that unfortunately many of us confront. TBAA shows us that nothing is always easy without some sort price to pay.I hope that you will see other reviews and not just take my words alone. This show is a good life experience

reviewText: Even though I received this in the mail a while ago, I have just now realized that I never wrote a review for it.  Anyway, I waited so long for volume two to come out and when I saw that it had, I immediately went and purchased it.  As usual, it came in the mail in a prompt and timely fashion, all the discs were okay and the episodes...well the episodes were incredible.  They were exactly as I remember them when I first saw them on CBS many years ago.The show still manages to bring tears to my eyes as I watch each episode, even though I have seen these episodes several times before, whether they were on PAX or CBS.  I miss the show very much and I truly hope that the rest of the series will eventually come out on DVD.  In all honesty, I don't care if it is split up into volumes (okay I care, but you know what I mean).  All I want is to be able to watch my favorite show when I have the chance and not have to worry about setting the VCR to record it.All in all, this is a great buy for anyone who has seen the show and  loved it.

reviewText: The angels fullfill their goal as messengers of GOD in helping people do or say what is needed to improve their lives. Tess, Monica, Andrew, and other angels are played by talented actors and actresses. Tess is the driving force for missions in her supervisory role. Monica is somewhat goofy as she tries very hard to do her part and messes up frequently. Andrew is compassionate as Angel of Death, but he also knows when to be forceful to complete the mission. I have been watching this series since it came to TV and it is one of my favorite shows. I like that no language or unnecessary violence, etc. is included.
summary: Filled with home and family values.

reviewText: My wife is actually the one who wanted this series. I used to watch it myself and as the years wore on since cancellation of the series, I had actually forgotten how good it was. It felt good for both of us to see this series again. So I guess the proper heading for this review should be, "Touched By A Memory." Thanks a lot. Robert Cockerham.

reviewText: I'm a guy and I think I got something out of almost every episode of Touched By An Angel. I try to think of low points and I can't. It was always good. My only complaint is my favorite t.v. series is taking the longest to come out. Mash with 11 seasons came out in 4 or 5 years, and here 3 years later we are still on Season 3 of Touched. Please don't split up the seasons anymore, I don't want to be old by the time Season 9 comes around. I want to be able to enjoy any episode for years to come, and I want to be able to share them with others as well.
